decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing fast mana (such as Moxen and Black Lotus) to power out disruptive artifacts like Sphere of Resistance, Null Rod, and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent while quickly deploying threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Nettlecyst. Mishra's Workshop helps ramp out powerful artifacts, while Wasteland and Ghost Quarter disrupt the opponent's mana base. Crucible of Worlds and Strip Mine provide additional land disruption, and Karn, the Great Creator can tutor for key artifacts like Pithing Needle or Sorcerous Spyglass to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around utilizing fast mana sources and powerful draw spells to assemble a game-winning combo using cards like Tendrils of Agony, Time Vault, and Bolas's Citadel. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The key strategy is to efficiently generate mana, draw cards, and manipulate the top of the deck to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game in a single turn.

This deck is focused on using Mishra's Workshop and various artifacts to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt opponent's strategies. The key idea is to accelerate mana production with artifacts like Sol Ring and Moxen, while using cards like Crucible of Worlds and Strip Mine to disrupt opponent lands. Golos, Tireless Pilgrim is used to ramp and fetch utility lands like Karakas and Tolarian Academy, while cards like Nettlecyst and Patchwork Automaton provide threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Chalice of the Void, Null Rod, and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale.

This deck is focused on leveraging the powerful card Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana while also utilizing artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to ramp up quickly. It includes combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to assemble a winning board state. The deck also features disruptive elements like Force of Will and Dress Down to protect the combo and control the game. Overall, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan using counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It also utilizes the Lurrus of the Dream-Den companion to gain value from recurring cheap permanents. The deck includes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Black Lotus to generate card advantage and tempo. The artifact package with cards like Moxen, Time Vault, and Manifold Key provides mana acceleration and synergy with the control elements of the deck. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol opponents in the Vintage format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to keep a steady stream of cards and threats. It includes a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push, along with powerful artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga. The mana base is designed to support both color requirements and utility lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption, card advantage, and incremental advantage from its companion and key spells.

The deck focuses on rapidly filling the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, enabling powerful graveyard synergies with cards like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam. Utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to help dig for key pieces, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures and recursive threats. The inclusion of disruption like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy helps protect the combo while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck's ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces makes it a formidable force in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disruption and protection, utilizing a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game. It aims to slow down opponents' strategies while setting up its own win conditions. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and a recurring threat. With a strong mana base and a variety of powerful spells, this deck seeks to outmaneuver and outlast opponents in order to secure victory in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck relies on assembling a powerful combo using Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It contains a variety of card draw and tutoring spells to help find the necessary pieces quickly, along with disruption in the form of countermagic like Force of Will. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional versatility and recursion to the deck. The goal is to efficiently set up the combo and win in a quick and decisive manner, while also having answers to disrupt opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. It also utilizes powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga, Moxen, and Time Vault to generate advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions through card advantage and efficient plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and land denial to disrupt opponents while efficiently deploying threats. It combines powerful artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Urza's Saga, and Wasteland with disruptive cards such as Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere to slow down opponents. The deck also includes key threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Nettlecyst to apply pressure and close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive artifact-based strategies while controlling the board with disruptive elements.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to generate mana and draw cards, with a particular emphasis on bouncing back key pieces with Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to assemble a powerful board state quickly using cards like Mishra's Workshop and Grim Monolith, while also disrupting the opponent's plays with Force of Will and Trinisphere. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Tinker allow for additional utility and combo potential, ultimately aiming to secure the win with cards like Time Vault and Coveted Jewel.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining card advantage. It uses various powerful spells and cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to control the game's pace. Additionally, it contains key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key to potentially win the game quickly. The deck also includes efficient mana ramp with Moxen and strong land disruption with Wasteland and Strip Mine. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control and strategic gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to generate large amounts of mana through artifacts such as Mishra's Workshop and mana rocks, then utilize Paradoxical Outcome to draw a significant number of cards while also bouncing key artifacts back to hand for additional plays. The deck includes powerful cards like The One Ring and Urza's Saga to further enhance its combo potential and aims to win the game quickly through explosive plays and card advantage. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Force of Will and Trinisphere help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifacts and disrupt their game plan with cards like Trinisphere and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck uses powerful mana acceleration like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats like Lodestone Golem and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim. It also features key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key for alternate win conditions. The deck utilizes synergy between artifacts and artifact tutors like Inventors' Fair and Urza's Saga to create a fast and efficient aggro strategy in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck utilizes Oath of Druids as a key strategy to cheat out powerful creatures like Sphinx of the Steel Wind and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board while quickly ramping up mana with powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen. It also has the potential to generate infinite turns with Time Vault and Manifold Key combo. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive spells.
